hypothesis_content.title: Multi-Catalyst Confluence Breakdown
hypothesis_content.statement: When a technical breakdown (e.g., loss of key support) coincides with a negative on-chain/metric catalyst (e.g., exchange net inflows, negative funding) within a 2-hour window, the resulting downward move will be amplified, exceeding the magnitude predicted by either catalyst alone by a factor of 1.8-2.5.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Technical traders act on the breakdown. Concurrent on-chain/metric deterioration provides fundamental/flow confirmation, activating a different cohort of sellers (long-term holders, institutional models). This multi-cohort selling creates amplified, cascading pressure as stops are hit and sentiment rapidly deteriorates.
entry_conditions: BTC breaks below a well-defined 4h support level (prior low) on elevated volume (>1.3x avg)
A concurrent negative on-chain signal triggers within ±2 hours: (a) Net exchange inflow spike (>5k BTC), OR (b) Aggregated funding rates turn deeply negative (< -0.02%)
The breakdown occurs during the LONDON or NY trading session (liquidity hours)
1h candle closes below support with catalyst confirmed

exit_conditions.take_profit: Move equal to 2.2x the average past three similar technical breakdown magnitudes (without confluence)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims the broken support level with a 4h close >1% above it

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Confluence events do not produce statistically significant larger moves compared to standalone technical breaks in a robust historical sample.
